anecdotes.title: Education
anecdotes.body: She obtained her BA from Acadia University in 1995. She then completed the MTEI program at SMU in 2017.

anecdotes.title: technology and Entrepreneurship
anecdotes.body: She is a co-founder and CEO of PinPoint Virtual and Karmabuyi. PinPoint is a virtual concierge and outsourcing service. Karmabuy is an online shopping mall for a social enterprise that allows showcasing of original art, crafts, and handiworks online in a 'storefront'.

anecdotes.title: Awards
anecdotes.body: She is recognized as a digital diversity leader by Digital Nova Scotia and earned the 2017 award for Women Leaders in the Digital Economy.

anecdotes.title: Contribution
anecdotes.body: She was a Faculty Advisor for the Enactus team at Saint Maryâ€™s University, a founding member of the Nova Scotia Women in Technology task force, and a member of the Techsploration Advisory Board.
